datafield.subfield: sponsored by the American Folklife Center ; assisted by the National Council for the Traditional Arts.
13 sound tape reels : analog, 7 1/2 ips, 2 track, mono. ; 10 in.
5 photographic prints : black and white ; various sizes

The collection consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, and photographs documenting the performance of Irish music, Ghanaian music and dance, Japanese koto music, Mexican string band music, Senegalese music, and West Virginia old-time music recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Thomas Jefferson Building, Library of Congress, at concerts from April through October 1982, sponsored by the American Folklife Center and the National Council for the Traditional Arts.
Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress)
National Council for the Traditional Arts,

did.abstract: The collection consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, and photographs documenting the performance of Irish music, Ghanaian music and dance, Japanese koto music, Mexican string band music, Senegalese music, and West Virginia old-time music recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Thomas Jefferson Building, Library of Congress, at concerts from April through October 1982, sponsored by the American Folklife Center and the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The 1982 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection consists of manuscript and print materials, audio recordings, and graphic materials that document the 1982 concert series sponsored by the American Folklife Center. The annual series, which began in 1977, features the presentation of folk traditions from many cultures. The concerts take place on the Neptune Plaza at the front of the Jefferson Building of the Library of Congress between May and October. Adverse weather conditions sometimes force the concerts indoors. The 1982 series was produced with the assistance of the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

The 1982 season consisted of the following:
Date Performers Place of Origin Subject
April 15 The Irish Tradition Maryland Irish music
May 20 Oboade Drumming and Dance Company District of Columbia Ghanaian music and dance
June 17 The Washington Toho Koto Society District of Columbia Japanese music
July 15 Los Pregoneros del Puerto California Mexican music
August 19 Djimo Kouyate District of Columbia Senegalese music
September 16 Dave Morris West Virginia Old-time country music
October 19 The Washington Toho Koto Society District of Columbia Japanese music

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Documentation created and accessioned by the American Folklife Center in 1982.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress)
National Council for the Traditional Arts, sponsor.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Listening and viewing access to the collection is unrestricted. Duplication of the materials requires prior permission of the Center and may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1982 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection (AFC 1982/011), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

row.entry: Ghanaian music and dance group led by master drummer Yacub Addy. They perform songs and dances from West African tribes that take place during ceremonial and social occasions. Narrated performance includes eight dances representing six ethnic groups. Print material, photographs, and slides: folders 5-6, envelopes 5-7; sound recordings: RWA 2546-47.
